Description: Unless "Use Server Name For World Name" is enabled, sets the name of a newly generated world. The world save file will be named accordingly in the Worlds directory. If the save file already exists and is not loaded under World Save Name, then an incrementally numbered save file will be created

Specifies the world save file in the Worlds directory to load on start. Creates the specified file if no World Name is set or "Use Server Name For World Name" is enabled. Creates a default world save file if otherwise unspecified
Sets the world seed to use for a newly generated world. Blank = random seed
Sets the size of a newly generated world
Sets the difficulty level of a newly generated world
Sets the evil state for a newly generated world
Sets the name of the server shown publicly
If set, the Server Name will be used as the world name of a newly generated world, with the world save file named as specified under World Save Name
DisplayName: Use Server Name For World Name

DefaultValue:
Welcome to [c/ffff00:%map%] on [c/7ddff8:T][c/81dbf6:S][c/86d7f4:h][c/8ad3f3:o][c/8ecef1:c][c/93caef:k] for [c/55d284:T][c/62d27a:e][c/6fd16f:r][c/7cd165:r][c/89d15a:a][c/95d150:r][c/a4d145:i][c/b1d03b:a].
[c/FFFFFF:Online players (%onlineplayers%/%serverslots%):] [c/FFFF00:%players%]
Type [c/55D284:%specifier%][c/62D27A:h][c/6FD16F:e][c/7CD165:l][c/89D15A:p] for a list of commands.
Description: Sets the server's [MOTD](https://ikebukuro.tshock.co/#/motd) (message of the day)
Sets the password for players to join the server. Default is no password
If set, enables the server's anti-spam feature
Sets the language of the server
If set, disables the text announcements that the Announcement Box makes when pulsed from wire
Sets the Announcement Box text messaging range. -1 = serverwide announcements
If set, the server’s backup autosave will be enabled. Backups are stored in the tshock/backups folder
If set, world autosave announcements will be enabled
If set, backup autosave messages will be shown
Sets the interval between backup autosaves
Sets how long backup autosaves are kept
If enabled, the world will be saved if the server crashes from an unhandled exception
If enabled, the world will be saved when the last player disconnects
DisplayName: Save World On Last Player Exit

Description: If set, the server will ignore API version checks for plugins, allowing old plugins to run
If enabled, the server will output debug level messages related to system operation
If set, disables sending logs as messages to players with the log permission
If set, prevents On Second Update checks from writing to the log file
If enabled, the server will suppress build permission failure warnings from regions, spawn point, or server edit failure
If set, disables UPnP (Universal Plug and Play) on the server
Sets the server process priority
Specifies additional command line parameters that are not otherwise set by AMP. ONE LINE ONLY! Use with care
If set, the server will be forced to continue running, and not hibernate when no players are connected. This will result in time passing, grass growing, and the CPU running
Sets the size of invasion events, based on: 100 + (multiplier x (number of active players with greater than 200 health))
Sets the default maximum number of mobs that will spawn per wave. Higher = more mobs in that wave
Sets the delay between waves. Lower = more mobs
If set, enables never-ending invasion events. The event still needs to be started, such as with the /invade command
Sets the server's PvP (player vs player) mode
If enabled, prevents tiles from being placed within the Spawn Protection Radius of the default spawn
Sets the tile radius around the spawn tile that is protected by the Spawn Protection setting
If set, enables anti-cheat range checks based on the distance between the player and their block placements
If set, only hardcore players cann connect. Don't enable Softcore Only or Mediumcore Only at the same time
If set, softcore players cannot connect. Don't enable Softcore Only or Hardcore Only at the same time
If set, only softcore players can connect. Don't enable Mediumcore Only or Hardcore Only at the same time
If set, disables any placing or removal of blocks
If set, hardmode will not be activated by the Wall of Flesh or the /starthardmode command
If set, prevents the dungeon guardian from being spawned, while sending players to their spawn point instead
If set, disables clown bomb projectiles from spawning
If set, disables snowball projectiles from spawning
If set, disables tombstone dropping during death for all players
If set, disables Skeletron Prime Bombs from spawning. Useful for preventing unwanted world destruction on "for the worthy" seed worlds
Forces the world time to the specified setting
If set, disables the effect of invisibility potions while PvP is enabled, by making the player visible to the other players
Sets the maximum distance that disabled players can move from
If enabled, region protection will apply to chests
If enabled, region protection will apply to gem locks
DisplayName: Enable Region Protection For Gem Locks

Description: Sets the maximum damage a player/NPC can inflict
Sets the maximum damage a projectile can inflict
If set, ignores checks to see if a player can update a projectile
If set, ignores checks to see if a player can kill a projectile
If enabled, allows players to break temporary tiles (grass, pots, etc) where they cannot usually build
If enabled, allows ice placement even where a player cannot usually build
If enabled, allows the crimson to spread when a world is in hardmode
If enabled, allows the corruption to spread when a world is in hardmode
If enabled, allows the hallow to spread when a world is in hardmode
Sets how many NPCs a statue can spawn within 200 pixels before it stops spawning
Sets how many NPCs a statue can spawn within 600 pixels before it stops spawning
Sets how many NPCs a statue can spawn before it stops spawning
If enabled, prevents banned items from being spawned or given with commands
If enabled, prevents players from interacting with the world while they are dead
If enabled, prevents players from placing tiles with an invalid style
If enabled, forces Christmas-only events to occur all year
If enabled, forces Halloween-only events to occur all year
If enabled, allows groups on the banned item allowed list to spawn banned items even if Prevent Banned Item Spawn is enabled
DisplayName: Allow Allowed Groups To Spawn Banned Items

Description: If enabled, allows stacks in chests to go beyond the stack limit during world loading
If enabled, boss spawning and invasion starts will be announced
Sets the range over which a bomb can affect tiles from its detonation point

If enabled, items given to players will be inserted directly into their inventory. Requires SSC. Otherwise, items given to players will spawn as dropped items. Experimental - may not work correctly or may result in item loss
If set, prohibits the use of the Zenith projectile with different objects instead of weapons
If set, enables protection against creating custom messages with death
Specifies which string starts a command. Note: Will not function properly if the string length is bigger than 1
Specifies which string starts a command silently. Note: Will not function properly if the string length is bigger than 1
Sets the maximum numbers of players that can connect at one time
Sets the number of reserved slots above the Player Limit that can be joined by reserved players
If set, enables the server's whitelist based on IP addresses in tshock/whitelist.txt

DefaultValue: You are not on the whitelist.
Description: Sets the reason given when kicking players for not being on the whitelist

DefaultValue: Server is full. No reserved slots open.
Description: Sets the reason given when kicking players that attempt to join while the server is full with no reserved slots available
DisplayName: Server Full With No Reserved Slots Reason

Description: Sets the reason given when kicking players that attempt to join while the server is full
Sets the default group name to place newly registered users under
Sets the default group name to place unregistered players under
If enabled, remembers where a player left off, based on their IP. Does not persist through server restarts
If enabled, requires all players to register or login before being allowed to play
If enabled, allows players to login to any account even if the username doesn't match their character name
If enabled, allows players to register a username that doesn't necessarily match their character name
Sets the number of failed login attempts before kicking a player
If set, prevents players from being able to login before they finish connecting
If enabled, displays a player's IP on join to users with the log permission
If enabled, a player's geographic location will be announced on join, based on their IP
If set, and Announce Player Geographic Location is enabled, users identified as being under a proxy will be kicked
If set, disables IP bans by default, if no arguments are passed to the ban command
Sets the minimum password length for new user accounts
Determines the BCrypt work factor to use. If increased, all passwords will be upgraded to the new work-factor on verify. The number of computational rounds is 2^n. Increase with caution
If set, prevents players from being able to login with their client UUID
If enabled, clients that don't send their UUID to the server will be kicked
If enabled, mediumcore players will be kicked on death
Sets the reason given when kicking a mediumcore player on death
If enabled, mediumcore players will be banned on death
Sets the reason given when banning a mediumcore player on death
If enabled, hardcore players will be kicked on death
Sets the reason given when kicking a hardcore player on death
If enabled, hardcore players will be banned on death
Sets the reason given when banning a hardcore player on death
Sets the period a player must wait before being respawned. Use at your own risk
Sets the period a player must wait before being respawned if there is a boss nearby. Use at your own risk
Sets the maximum HP a player can have, before equipment buffs
Sets the maximum MP a player can have, before equipment buffs
Disables a player if the set number of tiles is painted within 1 second
If enabled, players will be kicked when they surpass the Tile Paint Threshold
DisplayName: Kick On Tile Paint Threshold Broken

Description: Disables a player and reverts their actions if the set number of tile kills is exceeded within 1 second
If enabled, players will be kicked when they surpass the Tile Kill Threshold
DisplayName: Kick On Tile Kill Threshold Broken

Description: Disables a player and reverts their actions if the set number of tile places is exceeded within 1 second
If enabled, players will be kicked when they surpass the Tile Place Threshold
DisplayName: Kick On Tile Place Threshold Broken

Description: Disables a player if the set number of liquid sets is exceeded within 1 second
If enabled, players will be kicked when they surpass the Tile Liquid Threshold
DisplayName: Kick On Tile Liquid Threshold Broken

Description: If enabled, players will be kicked when they surpass the Maximum Player/NPC Damage
If set, shrapnel from crystal bullets will be ignored for the projectile threshold count
Disables a player if the set number of projectiles is created within 1 second
If enabled, players will be kicked when they surpass the Projectile Threshold
Disables a player if the set number of Heal Other Player packets is sent within 1 second
If enabled, players will be kicked when they surpass the Heal Other Threshold
DisplayName: Kick On Heal Other Threshold Broken

Description: Changes in-game chat format: {0} = Group Name, {1} = Group Prefix, {2} = Player Name, {3} = Group Suffix, {4} = Chat Message
If enabled, chat messages will be displayed above players' heads
Changes the player name when using Chat Above Heads. Starts with a player name wrapped in brackets, as per Terraria's formatting. Same formatting as Chat Format without the message
Sets the superadmin chat prefix
Sets the superadmin chat suffix
If set, enables the REST API
If enabled, REST API connections will be logged
If enabled, token authentication will be required to use the public REST API endpoints
Sets the maximum REST API requests in the bucket before denying requests
DisplayName: Maximum REST API Requests Per Interval

Description: Sets how often the REST API requests bucket is decreased by one
DisplayName: REST API Request Bucket Decrease Interval

Description: Sets the type of database to use when storing data
Sets the path of the SQLite database, when using the SQLite database type
Sets the MySQL hostname and port to direct connections to, when using the MySQL database type
Sets the database name to connect to when using the MySQL database type
Sets the username to use when connecting to a MySQL database
Sets the password to use when connecting to a MySQL database
If enabled, logs will be saved to the SQL database instead of a text file
Sets the number of times the SQL log must fail to insert logs before falling back to the text log
Sets the [ASP.NET Core 6.0 version](https://dotnet.microsoft.com/en-us/download/dotnet/6.0) to install for TShock. NOTE: Update the server after switching versions!
This downloads a default backup exclude file to save space on backups by only saving specific directories. If this is disabled, you will need to manually delete the .backupExclude file it downloads
